item.title: Lisa add a quote by Architect Ludwig Mies van der Rohe
item.description: "Less is More" -- Architect Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Be grateful, be smart, be clean, be true, be humble, be prayerful." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "Big girls need big diamonds." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "And now," cried Max, "let the wild rumpus start!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Lisa add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Maurice Sendak
item.description: "Oh, please don't go—we'll eat you up—we love you so!" -- Maurice Sendak

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "My daddy said, that the first time you fall in love, it changes you forever and no matter how hard you try, that feeling just never goes away." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "The greater the love, the greater the tragedy when it's over." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "eventually, everything goes away." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I met an old lady once, almost a hundred years old, and she told me, 'There are only two questions that human beings have ever fought over, all through history. How much do you love me? And Who's in charge?" -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "You are, after all, what you think. Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I am a better person when I have less on my plate." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I was full of a hot, powerful sadness and would have loved to burst into the comfort of tears, but tried hard not to, remembering something my Guru once said -- that you should never give yourself a chance to fall apart because, when you do, it becomes a tendency and it happens over and over again. You must practice staying strong, instead." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "to travel is worth any cost or sacrifice." -- Elizabeth Gilbert
